name: Park Inn by Radisson Manchester, City Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had a 1 night stay and could not fault this hotel at all.Modern,Clean,Good Breakfast,Excellent location,Nice roomsJust next to main train station.....Car parking is not available but there is an NCP car park just oposite the hotel and a sign was advertising 8 pounds a day but i think the hotel has a special discount...Well done to all concerned
reviews.title: Excellent
Great!
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and found it to be clean, comfy and the staff very friendly. We got a Groupon deal where dinner and breakfast were included, and did not expect the food to be half as good as it was. Dinner was really tasty and served in a nice chilled athmosphere and breakfast was excellent with a massive selection of continental, full English and fruit salads.
The swimming pool was lovely (and quiet when we were there!) with plenty of loungers to read magazines and relax.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was a twin room which I find very hard to get lately, as I went to Manchester with my fiend and we both wanted our own beds! The room itself was very clean and tidy, the beds and pillows were that comfortable I had one of the best nights sleep for a long time. Towels that were left in the room were big and fluffy. The pool was a nice size and the area was very clean. It was very easy to get a taxi, it was a simple ask at the desk and within minutes the taxi arrived. The room service was great, we even ordered chips at 3am and that was better than looking for somewhere when on way back.
reviews.title: Appalling customer service

reviews.text: I have been to manchester before but I think this was the best hotel I have stayed at - I would definitely visit again
reviews.title: Quiet, modern, comfortable and efficient

reviews.text: I stayed here with 7 others for my brothers stag do on the 3rd and 4th of August. Staff were very polite and helpful giving us rooms together and even taking group photos for us.
reviews.title: Very welcoming and great location

reviews.text: The breakfast was excellent and the pool was very good - we went several times over the weekend.
reviews.title: Lovely staff, nice and clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were perfect yea and coffee facilities were replenished as we're the towels and it was nice to have a safe that was free to use.
reviews.title: Ok for overnight

reviews.text: It's very close to the city centre but the hotel were helpful I'm booking taxis when we were going further afield.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: Overall I can highly recommend this hotel and we will all be coming back in November.
reviews.title: just ok

reviews.text: I was probably expecting too much from this hotel so maybe I am not being fair but it was very disappointing. It is located on the edge of a busy dual carriageway opposite some crumbling secondhand furniture warehouses, in a very run down part of the city. It is though very close to the centre of Manchester being literally a few minutes walk from the Printworks and other attractions. This is pretty much the hotel's only saving grace apart from rather good bacon and sausages at the breakfast buffet. The walk from the hotel to the city centre is a bit grim though.
reviews.title: Cold and charmless atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you enter the hotel it feels like the entrance to an office block or conference centre. I am not sure what effect the interior designer was going for but if it was 'uninviting' then they succeeded. The bedroom was fine but the en-suite was very very dark with the type of light bulb that takes 5 mins or more to come up to full brightness. Even at full brightness it was dark! This might have been tolerable for a leisurely bath but as there was only a shower it all felt very gloomy.
reviews.title: A chain hotel that offers all the necessities

reviews.text: The view from the window was onto some new high rise apartments. Claustrophobic and rather depressing.
reviews.title: Hugely overinflated view of itself. Poor value for money.

reviews.text: We had a very good chicken wrap in the bar but at £12.95 it was way over priced. Lunch wasn't very peaceful as there were a few very loud, very drunk workmen. The hotel seems to be popular with coach parties and workmen of one sort or another.
reviews.title: Good Hotel but really bad service in the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For what it is it is way overpriced. Will definitely stay somewhere else when we are next in Manchester.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but bad experience at the spa

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the hotel for a hen do and it was a fabulous place to stay. There was a few other hen and stag do's there too so it was obviously a popular choice! Great location only a 5/10 walk from the Printworks. The hotel was clean and modern and the beds comfy. The shower was really good and the rooms were air conditioned (both of which were needed the morning after!) The Spa facilities also looked lovely, although unfortunately we didn't have time to use them. The breakfast was also great and ran until 11am on the Sunday so you could even have a lie in. Overall, I would definitely recommend the hotel to others.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for a Hen Do!

reviews.text: Whilst meeting up with friends in Manchester for the weekend, I stayed at this hotel and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is modern, very clean and the breakfast was excellent with lots of choice.
reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable and modern hotel...

reviews.text: The shower was powerful, the blackout curtains were a bonus and the beds were very comfortable. The staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Park Inn Business Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One night stay this weekend, was a fantastic stay. Hotel exceptionally clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Close to city centre, easy to walk to main attractions.Would highly recommend a stay at The Park Inn when staying in Manchester. Nicola Crawshaw
reviews.title: Great weekend at a great hotel

aka: Park Inn By Radisson Manchester Victoria Hotel
